Description: Fragment of fattened handle from a probably Samian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine micaceous buff. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and frontal lion head symbol. Corners of stamp rounded at one end.
Curator's comments: cf. Grace, V., 'Kouriaka', in Studies presented in memory of Porphyrios Dikaios, Nicosia 1979, 183, n.2. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 136, 4.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0059)
